sentence.Network_en: His fingers splay out in a star shape.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the sense 'unfold to view, display'): shortening of the verb display

encyclopedia.content: 基本情报 别名 スプレイ 出身地 日本 ジャンル ロック 职业 ロック・ポップバンド 活动期间 2000年～2008年12月2日 レーベル ポニーキャニオン 事务所 シンコーミュージック 公式サイト http://www.splay.jp/ メンバー 向井隆昭 Vo. G. 园木理人G. 东俊介B. 道本卓行Dr. 概要2000年に大阪の高槻市にある大阪府立岛上高等学校の卒业生でTHPLAYとして结成される。地元・大阪のライブハウス・セカンド

entry.tran: (使)(物体的多个末端)向外张开
entry.def: If things splay or are splayed, their ends are spread out away from each other.

example.ex: He splayed his fingers across his face...
His fingers splay out in a star shape...

means.word_mean: 1. an outward bevel around a door or window that makes it seem larger

sentences.sentence: "He splayed his huge hands over the table"
"These birds can splay out their toes"
"ballet dancers can rotate their legs out by 90 degrees"
"the artificial hip joint luxated and had to be put back surgically"

means.word_mean: 1. turned outward in an ungainly manner;

auth_sentence.content: Though she didn't need a walker, he had noticed her splay-footed gait as she came in.

auth_sentence.content: She had a munificent splay of long silver hair and a raspy voice, though she didn't smoke and was even a vegan.
